thread.title: PBR World Finals brings top ranked bull riders to Las Vegas
thread.title_full: PBR World Finals brings top ranked bull riders to Las Vegas

title: PBR World Finals brings top ranked bull riders to Las Vegas
text: Share Updated: 12:56 pm LAS VEGAS (KSNV News3LV) -- For 22 straight years, professional bull riders have flocked to Las Vegas for the PBR World Finals, and this year is no different. The globe's best bull riders will be holding tight and flying high at UNLV’s Thomas and Mack Center for the 2015 PBR Built Ford Tough World Finals.The coveted gold buckle will go to The PBR World Champion along with a $1 million prize and major bragging rights. This year’s competition will be the last time the World Finals will be held at Thomas & Mack, in 2016 the championship will be held at the new Las Vegas Arena. The top 40 bull riders in the world will ride through five rounds from Wednesday to Sunday. From there, the top 15 bull riders after five rounds of competition will be determined. That will then specify who will advance to the Built Ford Tough Championship Round on Sunday. Riders Derek Kolbaba, Neil Holmes, Luis Blanco, Justin Paton and Michael Lane have earned their way to the Built Ford Tough World Finals through the BlueDEF Velocity Tour Finals. PBR’s Pink Promise campaign is raising money for the Breast Cancer Research Foundation (BCRF) on Thursday night with the Pink Night Buckathon. The organization will donate $250 for each qualified ride and $1,000 for every 90-point ride during Round 2. Fans are encouraged to wear pink to show their support. Ticket prices for the PBR World Finals start at $30 and can be purchased at the Thomas & Mack Center Box Office or online at UNLV Tickets . Click here for more information about PBR's Pink Promise .
